camel.sink.path.serverUrls.name: camel.sink.path.serverUrls
camel.sink.path.serverUrls.description: The zookeeper server hosts (multiple servers can be separated by comma)

camel.sink.path.path.name: camel.sink.path.path
camel.sink.path.path.description: The node in the ZooKeeper server (aka znode)

camel.sink.endpoint.listChildren.name: camel.sink.endpoint.listChildren
camel.sink.endpoint.listChildren.description: Whether the children of the node should be listed

camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.timeout
camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.description: The time interval to wait on connection before timing out.

camel.sink.endpoint.create.name: camel.sink.endpoint.create
camel.sink.endpoint.create.description: Should the endpoint create the node if it does not currently exist.

camel.sink.endpoint.createMode.name: camel.sink.endpoint.createMode
camel.sink.endpoint.createMode.description: The create mode that should be used for the newly created node One of: [PERSISTENT] [PERSISTENT_SEQUENTIAL] [EPHEMERAL] [EPHEMERAL_SEQUENTIAL]

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.zookeeper.listChildren.name: camel.component.zookeeper.listChildren
camel.component.zookeeper.listChildren.description: Whether the children of the node should be listed

camel.component.zookeeper.timeout.name: camel.component.zookeeper.timeout
camel.component.zookeeper.timeout.description: The time interval to wait on connection before timing out.

camel.component.zookeeper.create.name: camel.component.zookeeper.create
camel.component.zookeeper.create.description: Should the endpoint create the node if it does not currently exist.

camel.component.zookeeper.createMode.name: camel.component.zookeeper.createMode
camel.component.zookeeper.createMode.description: The create mode that should be used for the newly created node One of: [PERSISTENT] [PERSISTENT_SEQUENTIAL] [EPHEMERAL] [EPHEMERAL_SEQUENTIAL]

camel.component.zookeeper.lazyStartProdu.name: camel.component.zookeeper.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.zookeeper.lazyStartProdu.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.zookeeper.basicPropertyB.name: camel.component.zookeeper.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.zookeeper.basicPropertyB.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
